instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image but is working on external monitor
threads.message: I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and it doesn't give me an image but works perfect on external monitor so i checked the connector pins on the schematics and looks so confusing compared withe the other boards and also i have to use board view file similar to that board because is not available yet. Anyway i have 5v on pin 28 to 30 i also have power on pin 54v on 1 i have voltage on pin 3 but pin 8 i don't have anything that's <SIGNAL>LCS_BKLT_PWM_R</SIGNAL> so i believe that's the brightness and its coming from <SIGNAL>EDP_IG_BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> and thats coming from <CHIP>U1100</CHIP> if im right. Any ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Image but is working on external monitor
threads.message: If you have 54V on pin 1 the backlight should work. Do a PRAM reset first, then try a known good LCD assembly. Must be mid 2015 assembly!
